meanings.definition: An action or omission that constitutes an offense that may be prosecuted by the state and is punishable by law.
meanings.sent2: The police are investigating the crime.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cookie steal the chocolate chips? It committed a crime!
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was a crime against art.
meanings.sent5: The crime scene was marked with caution tape.

meanings.definition: An illegal act for which someone can be punished by the government.
meanings.sent2: He was arrested for committing a serious crime.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was charged with tree-climbing crimes.
meanings.sent4: The pollution of the river is a crime against nature.
meanings.sent5: The crime rate in the city has decreased significantly.
